metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7575 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) before 3.20.2, as used in MozillaFirefox before 43.0.2 and Firefox ESR 38.x before 38.5.2, does not rejectMD5 signatures in Server Key Exchange messages in TLS 1.2 HandshakeProtocol traffic, which makes it easier for man-in-the-middle attackers tospoof servers by triggering a collision.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7575` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.21-1ubuntu2
libnss3-tools - 2:3.21-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

gnutls-bin - 3.3.18-1ubuntu1
libgnutls-dane0 - 3.3.18-1ubuntu1
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.3.18-1ubuntu1
libgnutls30 - 3.3.18-1ubuntu1
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.3.18-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2e-1ubuntu1
openssl - 1.0.2e-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

firefox - 43.0.4+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 43.0.4+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 43.0.4+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 43.0.4+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

openjdk-8-demo - 8u72-b15-1
openjdk-8-jdk - 8u72-b15-1
openjdk-8-jdk-headless - 8u72-b15-1
openjdk-8-jre - 8u72-b15-1
openjdk-8-jre-headless - 8u72-b15-1
openjdk-8-jre-zero - 8u72-b15-1
openjdk-8-source - 8u72-b15-1
No subscription required

libmbedcrypto0 - 2.2.1-2
libmbedtls10 - 2.2.1-2
libmbedx509-0 - 2.2.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nss package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:3.21-1ubuntu2').
gnutls28 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.3.18-1ubuntu1').
openssl package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.2e-1ubuntu1').
firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '43.0.4+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
openjdk-8 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8u72-b15-1').
mbedtls package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.1-2').
